page.title: 11CHANGES IN WITHAM IN 20TH C.
page.content: {SINCE 1966 } In 1966 began the Town Development Scheme,with some of the money coming from the GLC. New Factories, offices, and shops, community centres and the Sports Centre were built as well as the houses. The first houses in this scheme were on the Templars Estate and the next were on Forest Road. A comment from two elderly ladies brought up in Witham:-"We're lucky really,we've got the Co-op up here and the Post Office..I saw a friend of mine up here the other day - when they were building it there ,she was awfully upset and she said how useful it was.And I said 'Yes ,we grumbled about the buildings, and then as you get older you find they're useful.'." Most families had moved here from London but most of the Junior children have lived here from their birth.
